title: Birth of a Hero without the distress
author: cmgladdis

comments.content:
You are probably looking for **[Devil Breeze (Book)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Devil%20Breeze%20-%20Book&fid=6526253719859d1bc84e4d2ca88494c9&fsize=60&text=REVOLUTION%20-%20revolution%20ECCENTRIC%20ELEMENTS&wrap=2)** free font by Wesley Pastrana [Weslo Gfx, 2010]  
The lowercase glyphs are "normal" capital letters, while in the uppercase you can find some customizations as your /T, although I can't find the /U of your sample
Thats exactly it. Thanks so much. It even has the U.

Don't know this Devil Breeze but I'm afraid it's a blatant [Avant-Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic) rip-off. And actually, this sample all looks like Avant-Garde Gothic using some stylistic alternates and ligatures: [UT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/540757/356), [NT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/540757/342), [V](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/540757/302), [M](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317134044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/540757/292). Birth of A Hero is also a (illegal?) roughened version of Avant-Garde Gothic... Better go with the original...

I think Ryuk is right. Avant-Garde Gothic has everything you need, you better go with the original ;)  
Thanks Ryuk :)
